data.sampled:
What are some examples of words in the Brazilian language that were originally derived from other languages but have become a part of the lexicon?</s> 
1. "Bola" - This word comes from the Portuguese word "bolo" meaning round object. It is used in the Brazilian language to refer to all kinds of balls, whether they come from a sport or not. 

2. "Barato" - This word comes from the Spanish word "barato" meaning cheap. In Brazil, it is used to refer to objects or services that are lower in price. 

3. "Abacaxi" - This word comes from the Tupi language and refers to a type of fruit that is native to Brazil. It is also used to refer to pineapple in some parts of the country. 

4. "Moro" - This word comes from the Arabic language and refers to an Arab or Muslim person who resides in Brazil. 

5. "Eclético" - This word comes from the Greek language and refers to something that is characterized by a mixture of elements. It is used in Brazilian culture to refer to an object or person that has a unique style or characteristics.
